japanesTitle: シーザーを捕獲せよ 将軍砲（ジェネラルキャノン）炸裂
romanizedTitle: Shīzā o Hokaku-seyo - Jeneraru Kyanon Sakuretsu
description: Franky battles Buffalo and Baby 5 using his General Franky Shogun form, unleashing the devastating General Cannon attack. When the Donquixote Pirates attempt to escape with Caesar, Luffy entrusts Usopp and Nami to stop them, demonstrating his faith in his crew's abilities.

events.title: Franky Shogun vs Buffalo and Baby 5
events.description: Franky in his General Franky Shogun form engages in combat with Donquixote Doflamingo's subordinates Buffalo and Baby 5. Baby 5 transforms using her Buki Buki no Mi powers to attack the massive robot.
events.significance: Demonstrates Franky's post-timeskip power upgrade and introduces the formidable General Franky Shogun in battle.

quotes.text: You two deserve credit only for breaking through the robot's armor. You're like a praying mantis taking on a warship!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky taunting Buffalo and Baby 5 after they damage his Shogun's armor

events.title: Baby 5's Sickle Girl Form
events.description: Buffalo spins Baby 5 on one of his chains, and she uses her Sickle Girl form to impale Franky Shogun's left arm, successfully penetrating the robot's armor.
events.significance: Shows Baby 5's versatile weapon transformation abilities and the coordination between the two Donquixote Pirates.

events.title: General Cannon Unleashed
events.description: Franky grabs Baby 5 and yanks on the chain, causing Buffalo to lose balance. He then declares that the Gaon Cannon has set foot on land and unleashes Franky Shogun's most powerful attack, the General Cannon, a devastating blast of compressed air.
events.significance: Introduction of Franky's most powerful post-timeskip attack, a land-based version of the Thousand Sunny's Gaon Cannon. The attack deals heavy damage across a large area of Punk Hazard's ice mountains.

quotes.text: The Gaon Cannon has set foot on land! General Cannon!
quotes.speaker: Franky

events.title: Mine Cart Escape
events.description: The Straw Hats, G-5 Marines, and others escape from the facility using a mine cart, racing through the tunnels. The G-5 Marines nearly fall during the escape sequence.
events.significance: The group successfully evacuates from Caesar's laboratory as Punk Hazard becomes increasingly dangerous.

events.title: Buffalo and Baby 5 Retreat with Caesar
events.description: Seeing that Law has allied with the enemy and that the odds are against them, Buffalo and Baby 5 decide to retreat from Punk Hazard with Caesar Clown in their possession, using Buffalo's spinning abilities to fly away.
events.significance: Creates urgency as the plan to capture Caesar is jeopardized. Law's betrayal becomes clear to the Donquixote Pirates.

events.title: Luffy Trusts Usopp and Nami
events.description: Before Law could stop the fleeing pirates, Luffy stops him, declaring that Usopp and Nami will handle the situation. This demonstrates Luffy's complete faith in his crew members' abilities.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's growth as a captain and his absolute trust in every member of his crew, even in critical situations. This moment exemplifies the bond between the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Usopp and Nami will handle this.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy stopping Law and showing faith in his crew

events.title: Nami's Thunder Breed Tempo
events.description: Nami attacks first, using her Weather Egg and Gust Sword to generate wind, then unleashing Thunder Breed Tempo to knock Buffalo, Baby 5, and Caesar out of the sky with a powerful lightning attack.
events.significance: Showcases Nami's advanced weather manipulation abilities post-timeskip, demonstrating her growth as a combatant.

events.title: Usopp's Shooting Star Rush
events.description: As Buffalo, Baby 5, and Caesar fall from the sky, Usopp attacks them with Totsugeki Ryuseigun (Shooting Star Rush), shooting several pieces of stone from the rubble at them. The final shot contains seastone handcuffs that catch Caesar around the neck.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's improved precision and tactical thinking, using seastone to neutralize Caesar's Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.text: Escaping is useless! That last shot was seastone handcuffs!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

events.title: Caesar Captured - Plan Step One Complete
events.description: As Buffalo, Baby 5, and Caesar fall into the ocean, Law declares that the first step of his plan is complete. Caesar has been successfully captured with seastone handcuffs, neutralizing his powers.
events.significance: Major milestone in Law's plan to take down Doflamingo. The capture of Caesar Clown sets the stage for the Dressrosa Arc and the eventual confrontation with Doflamingo.

quotes.text: The first step of the plan is complete.
quotes.speaker: Law
quotes.context: Law confirming the successful capture of Caesar

events.title: Luffy Questions Law About His Crew
events.description: After the successful capture, Luffy asks Law what he thought about his crew's abilities, showing pride in his nakama and seeking acknowledgment of their strength.
events.significance: Reinforces the theme of crew bonds and Luffy's pride in his companions. Law's response validates the Straw Hats' capabilities.

events.title: Doflamingo Approaches Punk Hazard
events.description: Far from Punk Hazard, Donquixote Doflamingo is shown flying toward the island using his string powers, imagining what torture he would inflict on the brats who interfered with his operations.
events.significance: Sets up the imminent confrontation between Doflamingo and the Straw Hat alliance. Creates tension and anticipation for the next phase of the arc.

events.title: Camel's Debut - Kuzan's Companion
events.description: A mysterious scene shows a giant penguin named Camel, revealed to be the companion of former Admiral Kuzan (Aokiji), as an unknown figure travels toward Punk Hazard.
events.significance: Introduction of Camel, Kuzan's super penguin companion, and foreshadowing of Aokiji's arrival at Punk Hazard. Builds mystery about Kuzan's current allegiances after leaving the Marines.

events.title: First Visible Ito Ito no Mi Strings in Anime
events.description: This episode marks the first time in the anime where Doflamingo's Ito Ito no Mi strings are actually visible on screen, shown very briefly as a flock of seagulls is struck by them.
events.significance: While Doflamingo's powers were first seen in the Jaya Arc and used multiple times, this is the first instance where the anime actually shows his invisible strings visually, providing viewers with a clearer understanding of his Devil Fruit ability.

quotes.text: You two deserve credit only for breaking through the robot's armor. You're like a praying mantis taking on a warship!
quotes.speaker: Franky

quotes.text: The Gaon Cannon has set foot on land! General Cannon!
quotes.speaker: Franky

quotes.text: Usopp and Nami will handle this.
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Escaping is useless! That last shot was seastone handcuffs!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

quotes.text: The first step of the plan is complete.
quotes.speaker: Law

themes.description: Luffy's unwavering faith in Usopp and Nami exemplifies the deep trust between the Straw Hat crew members.
themes.symbolism: The successful capture of Caesar through teamwork demonstrates that every crew member is valuable and capable.

themes.description: Franky's General Franky Shogun and upgraded weapons showcase the results of the two-year timeskip training.
themes.symbolism: The General Cannon as a land-based Gaon Cannon represents Franky's ability to adapt and innovate.

themes.description: The episode demonstrates tactical thinking with Usopp's use of seastone handcuffs and Nami's weather manipulation.
themes.symbolism: Brain over brawn - the Straw Hats succeed through clever tactics rather than pure power.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates the full power of his post-timeskip upgrade, General Franky Shogun, and his strongest attack.
keyActions: Damages Punk Hazard's ice mountains with compressed air blast
quotes: The Gaon Cannon has set foot on land! General Cannon!

characterSpotlights.development: Shows improved precision and strategic thinking by using seastone handcuffs to neutralize Caesar.
keyActions: Proves Luffy's faith in him was justified
quotes: Escaping is useless! That last shot was seastone handcuffs!

characterSpotlights.development: Showcases advanced weather manipulation abilities with Thunder Breed Tempo and Weather Egg.
keyActions: Knocks enemies out of the sky with lightning

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his growth as a captain by trusting his crew to handle critical situations.
keyActions: Shows complete faith in Usopp and Nami
quotes: Usopp and Nami will handle this.

mangaDifferences.difference: Baby 5 uses Flying Disk Girl and Fire Girl forms not shown in the manga.
The anime shows Nami generating wind using Gust Sword, while the manga did not specify which technique she used.
G-5 Marines nearly falling during the tunnel escape sequence is expanded in the anime.
First visible appearance of Doflamingo's string powers in the anime, shown as seagulls being struck by strings.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time in the anime where Doflamingo's Ito Ito no Mi strings are actually visible on screen, despite his powers being introduced much earlier in the series.
The General Cannon is described as a land-based version of the Thousand Sunny's Gaon Cannon, bringing Franky's shipwright expertise into his personal combat arsenal.

sources.title: Battle Frankies/General Franky | One Piece Wiki | Fandom

trivia.fact: Camel, the giant penguin, is several times the size of Kuzan and is capable of cooking barbecue by itself.
Episode 621 aired with an 8.1% TV rating in Japan, ranking 7th for the week.
Toei Animation stopped airing ending themes from Episode 279 to Episode 1070, which is why this episode has no ending song.

sources.title: One Piece Music | One Piece Wiki | Fandom
